    • Method Detail

      • getTaintPathTask

        protected abstract Runnable getTaintPathTask​(AbstractionAtSink abs)
        Gets the task that computes the result paths for a single abstraction. If the concrete path building algorithm does not want to handle the given abstraction, it can return null to not execute anything.
        Parameters:
        abs - The abstraction for which to compute the result paths

      • computeTaintPaths

        public void computeTaintPaths​(Set<AbstractionAtSink> res)
        Description copied from interface: IAbstractionPathBuilder
        Computes the path of tainted data between the source and the sink
        Parameters:
        res - The data flow tracker results

      • triggerComputationForNeighbors

        protected abstract boolean triggerComputationForNeighbors()
        Specifies whether the class shall create separate path reconstruction tasks for the neighbors of the abstractions that arrive at the sink
        Returns:
        True if separate path reconstruction tasks shall be started for each neighbor of each abstraction that reaches a sink, false if only the abstraction itself shall trigger a path reconstruction task

      • forceTerminate

        public void forceTerminate​(ISolverTerminationReason reason)
        Description copied from interface: IMemoryBoundedSolver
        Forces the solver to terminate its tasks and stop processing new tasks. This will kill the solver.
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason why the solver is terminated

      • scheduleDependentTask

        protected void scheduleDependentTask​(Runnable task)
        Schedules the given task for execution
        Parameters:
        task - The task to execute

        public InfoflowResults getResults()
        Description copied from interface: IAbstractionPathBuilder
        Gets the constructed result paths
        Returns:
        The constructed result paths

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Description copied from interface: IMemoryBoundedSolver
        Checks whether this solver is terminated, either by forced termination, or because it has finished all of its work.
        Returns:
        True if this solver is terminated, otherwise false

      • isKilled

        public boolean isKilled()
        Description copied from interface: IMemoryBoundedSolver
        Checks whether this solver was killed before it could complete its tasks
        Returns:
        True if this solver was killed before it could complete its tasks, otherwise false

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: IMemoryBoundedSolver
        Resets the solver to its initial state after it has been forcefully terminated. After calling this method, the solver is expected to accept new tasks.

      • getTerminationReason

        public ISolverTerminationReason getTerminationReason()
        Description copied from interface: IMemoryBoundedSolver
        In case this solver was killed before it could complete its task, this method returns the reason for the abortion. Otherwise, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        The reason for the abortion in case the solver was killed, otherwise null

      • addStatusListener

        public void addStatusListener​(IMemoryBoundedSolver.IMemoryBoundedSolverStatusNotification listener)
        Description copied from interface: IMemoryBoundedSolver
        Adds a new listener that will be notified of status changes in the solver
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener that will be notified when the status of the solver changes
